articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bereaved Family Members of Kim Dae Jung
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bereaved Family Members of Kim Dae Jung
 Kaesong, August 17 (KCNA) -- A wreath sent by Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of demise of former President Kim Dae Jung was conveyed to his bereaved family members on Sunday.
					 The wreath was courteously conveyed by Kim Yang Gon, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, to Kim Hong Op, son of Kim Dae Jung.
					
					 The ribbon of the wreath bore letters "In memory of late former President Kim Dae Jung" and "Kim Jong Un".
					
					 Kim Yang Gon courteously conveyed the words of profound sorrow sent by Kim Jong Un to the bereaved family members on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of demise of Kim Dae Jung.
					
					 Noting that Kim Dae Jung performed great feats on the road of national reunification, Kim Jong Un said the feats were more deeply cherished by people.
					
					 The relations between the peerless great men and Kim Dae Jung are the noblest and sincerest ones established on the road of working for the country, nation and reunification, Kim Jong Un said, hoping that the bereaved family members and those concerned of the Kim Dae Jung Peace Center would remain true to the intention of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the intention of Kim Dae Jung.
					
					 Being excited with the message of condolence, wreath and kind words personally sent by Kim Jong Un, Kim Hong Op and those concerned of the Kim Dae Jung Peace Center extended to him the warmest thanks reflecting the warm feelings of the bereaved family members and those concerned of the center.
					
					 Present there were Rim Tong Won, former minister of Unification, Pak Ji Won, lawmaker from the Democratic Alliance for New Politics, and those concerned of the center. They arrived in Kaesong by crossing the Military Demarcation Line that day.

articles.title: Gift from Bereaved Family Members of Kim Dae Jung
articles.content:
Gift from Bereaved Family Members of Kim Dae Jung
 Kaesong, August 17 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the bereaved family members of former President Kim Dae Jung.
					 The gift was conveyed to Kim Yang Gon, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, by Kim Hong Op, son of Kim Dae Jung, on Sunday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Gabon
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Gabon
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Ali Bongo Ondimba, president of Gabon, on the occasion of the 54th anniversary of its independence.
					 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries with a long-standing tradition would more dynamically develop in all fields, the message sincerely wished the president and people of Gabon greater successes in their work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Indonesia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Indonesia
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, president of Indonesia, on the occasion of the 69th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing the president and people of Indonesia greater successes in their work for the socio-economic development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Greets FM of Indonesia
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Greets FM of Indonesia
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Sunday sent a message of greeting to Raden Mohammad Marty Muliana Natalegawa, foreign minister of Indonesia, on the occasion of the 69th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations of mutual benefit between the two countries would continue developing on good terms in the common interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: US, S. Korea Will Have to Pay High Price: KPA General Staff
articles.content:
US, S. Korea Will Have to Pay High Price: KPA General Staff
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army Sunday issued a statement denouncing the United States and the south Korean puppet forces for setting about the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises again. 
					 The statement said:
					
					 The UFG is dangerous nuclear war drills aimed to mount a surprise preemptive strike at the DPRK under the deceptive signboard of "tailored deterrence" and adventurous ones to be staged under the simulated conditions of an actual war designed to ignite a "local and total war" any time under the pretext of non-existent "provocation" of someone.
					
					 The General Staff of the Korean People's Army clarified the principled retaliatory stand of the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK to cope with the war maniacs' reckless war moves against it, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Now that the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces declared a war against the DPRK by announcing their plan to apply the "tailored deterrence strategy" to an actual war, we re-clarify that the Korean-style most powerful and advanced merciless preemptive strike will start any time chosen by us.
					
					 If we strike the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces, they should be hit hard without any excuse and if we are determined, large and small bases for aggression will be reduced to a sea in flames and ashes.
					
					 The projected war maneuvers for aggression made the U.S. imperialists' scenario for their permanent presence in south Korea clear and brought the puppet authorities' sycophancy towards the U.S. and acts of treachery into bolder relief.
					
					 Under this situation, we unhesitatingly make public that our revolutionary armed forces will launch successive powerful physical offensives to resolutely terminate all this.
					
					 What we cannot overlook any longer is the U.S. imperialists' invariable attempt at their permanent presence in south Korea and the heinous acts of treachery of the puppet forces, modern-day five traitors of 1905.
					
					 Now that they more openly revealed their attempt never to give up their sinister ambition for "bringing down the social system in the north and occupying it" and "achieving unification through absorption" by putting the war maneuvers "on a regular and annual basis", our revolutionary armed forces will intensify their military counteraction for foiling them on a regular and annual basis.
					
					 Absolutely unpardonable are all crimes adding to the pent-up grudges of all Koreans under the pretext of "regular and annual drills."
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces will have to pay a dear price for their acts of going against the nation, reunification and peace as they reacted to all the peace initiatives and proposals made by the DPRK with good faith and magnanimity with extremely dangerous war maneuvers.
					
					 They bitterly regretted that they fought a wrong war with a wrong rival and in the wrong time and place. They should never regard this as what happened in the Korean war.
					
					 They should bear in mind that our revolutionary armed forces are sure to emerge an eternal victor and the enemies are fated to meet a miserable doom.

articles.title: DPRK Players Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Players Back Home
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK players returned home Sunday after taking part in the 11th World Junior and the 6th World Veteran Taekwon-Do Championships held in Dushanbe, Tajikistan.
					 In the junior championship they won 18 gold medals, three silver medals and seven bronze medals to be placed first in team standing.
					
					 They were greeted at Pyongyang Railway Station by Kim Yong Ho, secretary general of the Cabinet, officials concerned and family members.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday.
					 They included Glyn Ford, member of the National Policy Forum of the British Labor Party, and his party, Manuel Garcia Botaya, chief of the Paektusan Group of Spain, and a delegation of the Angola Doctor Association led by President Carlos Alberto Pinto de Sousa.
					
					 They paid high tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They paid homage to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who lie in state in humble reverence.
					
					 They went round the halls where the orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are on display and halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: DPRK Women's Football Team Beats Its US Rival 4:2
articles.content:
DPRK Women's Football Team Beats Its US Rival 4:2
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The DPRK soccer team defeated its U.S. rival 4:2 in the quarter finals on August 17 in local time in the 2014 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup now under way in Canada.
					 In the 11-meter penalty kick the DPRK team trounced its U.S. rival 3:1.
					
					 It will play the semi finals on August 21 in local time.

articles.title: Army and People Will Carry on March Started from Mt. Paektu: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
rmy and People Will Carry on March Started from Mt. Paektu: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The cause of building an invincible thriving nation which started with the march to Mt. Paektu will more dynamically advance and the army and people of the DPRK will win only victories in the march, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an editorial.
					 Nearly six decades have passed since leader Kim Jong Il pioneered the study tour of the revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu, the editorial notes, and goes on:
					
					 These days witnessed the glorious course in which the army and people of the DPRK have dynamically advanced along the march started from Mt. Paektu, following the party and the leader, despite all storms of history, and a proud course in which the dignity and honor of the country have been powerfully demonstrated along with Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The DPRK has shattered the vicious moves of the imperialists for a war of aggression with the spirit and grit of Mt. Paektu and created the example of the times in building socialism in the spirit of self-reliance of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu are the revolutionary university which trains the army and people of the DPRK into the indomitable revolutionaries and heroic army and people.
					
					 The study tour of the revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu is being more briskly made under the particular attention, expectation and care of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It is the steadfast will of Kim Jong Un to firmly adhere to the revolutionary traditions of Mt. Paektu, glorify them generation after generation and bring earlier the final victory in the revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 All the party members, service personnel and other people should invariably carry on the march started from Mt. Paektu shining with the undying revolutionary lives of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il under the unfurled banner of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and thus certainly achieve the final victory of the Korean revolution.

articles.title: US Cannot Conceal Its True Colors as "Human Rights Abuser": Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
US Cannot Conceal Its True Colors as "Human Rights Abuser": Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- U.S. President Obama in a recent press conference at the White House admitted that it is wrong for the U.S. to torture those suspected right after the September 11 accident, adding that it should own responsibility for it.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Sunday says: 
					
					 The U.S. chief executive admitted the torture on those detained, though belatedly. This is little short of his admitting the fact as the U.S. failed to conceal its ugly colors as the heinous human rights abuser before the world.
					
					 The U.S., however, set up secret prisons reminiscent of the veritable hell in other countries and has undisguisedly tortured and killed those detained. Under such situation it has no face to talk about "human rights" in other countries.
					
					 If the U.S. styles itself "defender of human rights", it will become undisguised challenge and unbearable insult to the world public giving priority to the respect for human rights.
					
					 Those who committed crimes should be punished.
					
					 The U.S. human rights abuses can never be overlooked as they are crimes against mankind.
					
					 The U.S. had better sit on the dock at a human rights tribunal.

articles.title: Yun Pyong Se Slammed for Imploring Outsiders to Stifle Fellow Countrymen
articles.content:
Yun Pyong Se Slammed for Imploring Outsiders to Stifle Fellow Countrymen
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Yun Pyong Se, puppet minister of Foreign Affairs of south Korea, during the recent international meeting implored foreign ministers of big powers to cooperate in the anti-DPRK campaign, vociferating about "missile threat from the north" and "threat of additional nuclear test". He talked about "joint counteraction of the international community". He went the lengths of blustering that the "high-performance nuclear capacity of the north should be deterred".
					 Minju Joson Sunday in a commentary says this reveals the ugly colors of the south Korean puppet forces, obsessed with dependence on outside forces and confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 Yun is the heinous confrontational maniac as he implored foreign forces to cooperate in the anti-DPRK campaign though he reduced south Korea to the fields for war saber-rattling and grave yard of human rights by kowtowing to the U.S. 
					
					 We are watching all the crimes of Yun who is turning his face away from the nation and currying favor with the U.S.
					
					 When an opportunity presents itself, we will sternly punish Yun in the name of the nation.
					
					 Regret will not mend matters. 
					
					 Yun had better behave with discretion, mindful of this.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive Censured for Pulling up DPRK over Its Deterrence for Self-Defence
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Censured for Pulling up DPRK over Its Deterrence for Self-Defence
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean chief executive made an "address for celebrating August 15" Friday. Letting loose a string of remarks about "preparations for unification", she talked about "formation of life community" through "channel of environment cooperation", "channel of people's life" and "channel of culture". She underlined the need to "overcome the history of contradiction and pain".
					 Meanwhile, she claimed that the tragedy of division persists and the inter-Korean relations are being bedeviled due to the "nuclear threat" of someone, adding that it is unpardonable that the north "threatens" the south with "nuclear development and missile launches".
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Sunday says her address is a window-dressing filled with hackneyed words as she repeated the preceding stand, having no solution to the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 We cannot but take a serious note of the fact that she talked about "threat" once again, pulling up the DPRK over its nuclear weapons and missiles.
					
					 The military threat on the Korean peninsula comes from the south, not from the north.
					
					 Is it not a threat to peace that Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises are soon to be staged with the approach of the Asian Games in Inchon?
					
					 The south Korean authorities should stop improper acts of groundlessly taking issue with the DPRK's deterrence for self-defence.
					
					 In order to open an epochal phase of improving the inter-Korean relations, it is necessary to settle without fail the basic issues set forth in the statement of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea.
					
					 Any act of denying this will be denounced by all fellow countrymen as it is an unreasonable act of going against national reconciliation, unity and independent reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Avoiding Probe into Truth about Disaster
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Avoiding Probe into Truth about Disaster
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Bereaved families of the ferry Sewol disaster held a press conference in Jongro District, Seoul on August 13, according to CBS of south Korea.
					 At the press conference speakers said that the chief executive should make a resolution to institute a special law to find out those responsible for the disaster and prevent its reoccurrence.
					
					 At the end of the press conference the bereaved families attempted to enter into Chongwadae.
					
					 The riot police inflicted harsh repression on them, having two of them lose their senses.

articles.title: Japan's Apology for Past Crimes Demanded by S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
Japan's Apology for Past Crimes Demanded by S. Korean Organization
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea held the 1139th Wednesday rally outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul on August 13 and demanded Japan make an official apology for the past crimes.
					 At the rally speakers said many victims of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army died with deep rancor against the Japanese imperialists' criminal acts.
					
					 They noted that the south Korean authorities should wrest an official apology and reparation from the Japanese government.
					
					 Then the organization handed over to the Japanese embassy the signature paper signed by more than 1,562,000 persons all over the world condemning the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.

articles.title: Declaration on Situation Published in S. Korea
articles.content:
Declaration on Situation Published in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Hardcore members of religious, civic and public circles of south Korea on August 13 published a declaration on the situation in demand of Japan's liquidation of the past crimes, according to CBS of south Korea.
					 The declaration said that the Japanese government should repent of the past crimes and properly liquidate them.
					
					 They handed over the declaration on the situation to the Japanese embassy and the speaker of the "National Assembly" and the "prime minister" of south Korea.

articles.title: Chosun Ilbo Assailed for Its Unreasonable Hysteria
articles.content:
Chosun Ilbo Assailed for Its Unreasonable Hysteria
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea, on August 13 carried an editorial titled "Chosun Ilbo's unreasonable hysteria".
					 The editorial said Chosun Ilbo is malignantly slandering the judgment made by the Seoul High Court which admitted the innocence of Ri Sok Gi, lawmaker from the Unified Progressive Party, suspected in the involvement in the case of the attempted rebellion.
					
					 Chosun Ilbo is resorting to mud-slinging is because its many articles are run through unilateral assertions of the Intelligence Service and the prosecution, it charged.
					
					 The case of the attempted rebellion is a political retaliation of the present regime on the Unified Progressive Party and a politically-motivated suppression, the editorial said, urging Chosun Ilbo stop hysteric fit.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in South Africa
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in South Africa
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution" was brought out in booklet by the Pretoria Copy Master Publishing House of South Africa on August 12.
					 The talk, published on August 25, Juche 102 (2013), deals with the Songun revolutionary leadership feats performed by leader Kim Jong Il and the essence and originality of the Songun revolutionary idea and indicates the tasks to successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Songun.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Ethiopian Personages
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Ethiopian Personages
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Round-table talks took place at the Gabriel and other hospitals, an enterprise and a metal and machine company of Ethiopia from August 6 to 12 on the occasion of the 69th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 A vice-director of the Gabriel Hospital praised President Kim Il Sung as the great man who not only achieved the historic cause of the country's liberation by defeating the Japanese imperialists but also turned the DPRK into the socialist power by beating back the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being "strongest" in the world.
					
					 The chief in charge of irrigation of an enterprise praised Kim Il Sung as the great man who rendered positive support to the African people in their struggle for national liberation against imperialism.
					
					 Other speakers said the DPRK is the beacon of hope for the progressives as it makes a long drive under the leadership of HE Kim Jong Un and that the exploits Kim Il Sung performed by liberating the country will go down for all ages.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by Serbian Political Party
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by Serbian Political Party
 Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The New Yugoslav Communist Party of Serbia posted on its website an article titled "Undying feats the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung performed by liberating Korea with arms" on August 13 on the occasion of the 69th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 August 15 is the 69th anniversary of Korea's liberation by President Kim Il Sung from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule, the article said, and went on:
					
					 Keenly realizing that if the country is liberated, one should hold arms, he comprehensively indicated the orientation and ways of doing so and founded the Korean People's Revolutionary Army on April 25, 1932.
					
					 He pulled through grim difficulties, led the armed struggle and the overall Korean revolution to victory, shattering the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and achieving the historic cause of the country's liberation longed for by the Korean people.
					
					 He wisely led the Korean people in their struggle for building a new country after its liberation, build the socialist state of Juche where the people become masters for the first time in the national history spanning five thousand years and created a grand history of the independent development and prosperity of the country and nation.
					
					 The revolutionary history and feats of Kim Il Sung who achieved the liberation of the country and built independent, rich and powerful socialist Korea are being successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
